title: Home stay of friends flares communal passions, situation under control

organizations.name: gsss institute of engineering and technology for women

text:
MANGALURU: Communal tension flared at Koila village in Puttur taluk after a friend from an engineering college came over for a stay in the house of a student from another community during vacations. This resulted in tense situation in the vicinity after members from both communities came to blows late on Tuesday.
On learning that friends of Khairunissa, who is a final engineering student at GSSS Institute of Engineering and Technology for Women, Mysuru had come to her house for stay, Hindu activists came to their house at Gokul Nagar in Koila and started objecting to their stay and claimed that girls were being kidnapped and brought to the house. Superintendent of police Bhushan Gulabrao Borase said Khairunissa's classmates Ramya, Reena and Sinchana (names changed) had come to Khairunissa's place three days ago to spend holidays and activists who noticed that girls from different communities stayed at a Muslim house started objecting and accused the family of kidnapping girls.
The girls had come to Khairunissa's home when she came home on Saturday and was scheduled to leave back on Wednesday. Members of saffron outfit started gathering at girl's house after a person spread rumours of Hindu girls being kidnapped. Khairunissa's father Mohammed, a Muslim cleric, was away from home during incident. As soon as the crowd started swelling, police were informed and they came to the spot at the earliest and stopped any untoward incident. The incident occurred around 7pm and crowd was disbursed immediately.
The SP, who with other police officials rushed to spot, asked both community members to maintain peace and brought the situation under control . He added that after the incident, girls decided to leave back to their college in Mysuru. However, when groups from both communities started dispersing peacefully, a person in an inebriated condition started making remarks about other community leading to clashes. During the clash, a person was injured and is being treated a private hospital, Borase added.
Two cases - one from an injured person and another from mother of Khairunissa - had been registered at Kadaba Police Station.
